publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-5315.1 John Park: Trading away Human Rights—As an amendment to motion (S3M-5315) in the name of Gil Paterson, insert at end "; notes the work of the Justice for Colombia campaign, a non-governmental organisation founded by trade unionists in 2002, which is supported by the TUC and campaigns for human rights, workers’ rights and peace with social justice in Colombia; further notes that Justice for Colombia is campaigning to stop the EU-Colombia Free Trade Agreement; commends the activity undertaken by trade unions across the United Kingdom to support trade unionists, political prisoners and the Colombian people, and looks forward to greater awareness of and support for the Justice for Colombia campaign." Motions and amendments which have attracted additional support
S3M-5315.1 Trading away Human Rights (lodged on 9 December 2009) Jamie Hepburn*

S3M-5315.1 John Park: Trading away Human Rights—As an amendment to motion (S3M-5315) in the name of Gil Paterson, insert at end "; notes the work of the Justice for Colombia campaign, a non-governmental organisation founded by trade unionists in 2002, which is supported by the TUC and campaigns for human rights, workers’ rights and peace with social justice in Colombia; further notes that Justice for Colombia is campaigning to stop the EU-Colombia Free Trade Agreement; commends the activity undertaken by trade unions across the United Kingdom to support trade unionists, political prisoners and the Colombian people, and looks forward to greater awareness of and support for the Justice for Colombia campaign." Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Bill Kidd*, Bill Butler*, Jackie Baillie*, Des McNulty*, David Stewart*, Marlyn Glen*
S3M-5315.1 Trading away Human Rights (lodged on 9 December 2009) Dr Richard Simpson*, Bill Wilson*, Rhona Brankin*, Mary Mulligan*, David Whitton*, Elaine Smith*
S3M-5315.1 Trading away Human Rights (lodged on 9 December 2009) Hugh O’Donnell*, Mr Frank McAveety*, Sandra White*
